Module kivakit.core.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.listeners

Interface MessageCounter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Listener, NamedObject, Receiver<Transmittable>, Transceiver
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MessageList, ValidationIssues
    public interface MessageCounter
extends Listener
    A listener, such as MessageList that is able to report how many of different kinds of messages it has seen. The count(Message.Status) message returns the number of messages of a given Message.Status type it has seen. For example, messages that represent failure (of which there is more than one) would have the step type Message.Status.FAILED. To get a count of a specific message type like Warning, the method count(Message.Status) can be used. To get the total of all messages that are higher than a given status severity (as determined by Message.Status.isWorseThan(Message.Status), the method countWorseThanOrEqualTo(Message.Status) can be used. For example, to find out how many messages represented something other than full success (warnings and worse), this code might be used: 
     var issues = messages.countWorseThan(Status.SUCCESS)
    To find out how many messages represented a failure to complete: 
     var issues = message.countWorseThan(Status.COMPLETED)
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
    See Also:
    Message, Message.Status, MessageList
